meanings.definition: To kick or strike with greater force than necessary.
meanings.sent1: He outkicked the ball, sending it flying over the fence.
meanings.sent2: She outkicked her opponent in the soccer match.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outkicked the ball so hard, it landed in the neighbor's yard!
meanings.sent4: Her determination outkicked any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The horse outkicked the rider, galloping ahead with great speed.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: The student outkicked all expectations with his science project.
meanings.sent2: The team outkicked their rivals in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The chef outkicked herself with the delicious dessert she created.
meanings.sent4: His creativity outkicked any previous records in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice outkicked all others, leaving the audience in awe.
